snippet.title: Don't be held hostage by the past
snippet.content: BILL Shorten's proposal to hold a referendum to seek support to move to a republic has its fans and opponents. Rogher Green doesn't like the idea (Daily, August 1). And rolls out the usual reasons whenever any change to move on from the early 20th century is proposed. You can tick them off. It's not a priority, it will cost billions, it's about winning a few votes, people will have to think about it followed by the clincher if you don't like it leave. They're the usual reasons rolled out when a change to move on from the early 20th century is proposed. Perhaps, it's not a top priority and is about winning some votes. So what? It won't cost billions (that's fiction). The real issue is that people might have to think. As upsetting as that might be for some, it's time we started to think about what the country needs to move ahead in the 21st century. And not be held hostage by the past.
